intro: Euphrasia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its hairy stems and leaves give it a distinctive appearance, and it is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Euphrasia hirsuta is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
